alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 5:32PM CDT until May 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Crockett. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated storm had moved east of the warned area...27 miles west of Ozona. However arroyo and small stream flooding is still possible due to earlier rainfall up to 2.5 inches of rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Crockett County - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 330 and 339. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Live Oak crossing Live Oak Creek and Live Oak Road crossing Live Oak Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
